revised_title: The Influence of Culture Fluids and Medicinal Agents on the Growth of Tuberculosis Bacteria
tldr: This study examines the growth and development of the tuberculosis bacteria under the influence of various culture fluids and medicinal agents. The researchers found that the bacteria did not multiply in distilled water but thrived in beef solutions. Arsenic, boracic acid, and perchloride of mercury did not hinder the bacteria's development, while quinine and iodine seemed to stop its growth and multiplication.
